name: Tao Zhang
content: Tao Zhang | New York Tech Staff & Faculty Directory Tao Zhang Professor; Computer Science, College of Engineering & Computing Sciences Professor; Electrical & Computer Engineering, College of Engineering & Computing Sciences Education Credentials: Ph.D.Expertise: Wireless Communications and NetworkingJoined New York Tech: 2005 Tao Zhang received her M.S. and Ph.D. degrees in computer science from the University of Texas at Dallas in 2003 and 2005, respectively. Her research interests span Artificial Intelligence focusing on Internet of Thing (IoT), Machine Learning with a particular focus on biomedical data, Mobile Edge Computing for Vehicular Networks, and Wireless Networks focusing on the design and analysis of network architectures and protocols. Zhang was the principal investigator of two National Science Foundation (NSF)-funded projects. She frequently serves on NSF proposal review panels. She is a senior member of the IEEE since 2007. She serves as a program chair of many IEEE conferences. She has been a technical committee member in numerous IEEE conferences, including ICC, Globecom, and Infocom. In addition, Zhang has served as a reviewer for numerous IEEE journals including IEEE Transactions on Network, IEEE Transactions on Wireless Communications, IEEE Selected Areas in Communications, and IEEE Communication Magazine. Recent Projects/Research NSF MRI grant, ECCS-1337965, “MRI: Acquisition of a DC/RF Sputtering System to Support Multidisciplinary Research on Medical Sensors and Micro-generators in WBAN”, PI: Dr. Tao Zhang, $230,063, 9/1/2013 – 8/31/2016. NSF TUES grant DUE-1044596, “Enhancing the Electrical and Computer Engineering Curriculum by Integrating Applications of Wireless Technology”, PI: Tao Zhang, $134,794, 10/1/2011 – 09/30/2015.
